duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage the Ohio Benefits Program risk management workstream to enable continued data sharing with CMS, IRS, and SSA through compliance with their program regulations.
Facilitate communication with risk management, legal, and procurement groups in DAS and with partner agencies for resolution.
Promote and ensure awareness of risk management requirements to meet state and federal compliance.
Complete risk assessments of new product releases, system enhancements, and service changes to supplement security assessments.
Maintain functional workstreams for audit activities and serve as the primary point of contact and coordinator for all Ohio Benefits Program audits.
Monitor and report audit findings and corrective action plans to leadership and partner agencies as directed.
Maintain and communicate audit schedule and coordinate audit activities with other program activities.
Attend required state staff meetings, make presentations to program, agencies, executive management, public and private groups as directed, and attend authorized conferences and seminars.

Work effectively in matrix and team-based structures, demonstrate professionalism in all interactions with both internal and external stakeholders, and continuously acquire and leverage current information relevant to job duties.

education_certification.credential: Completion of undergraduate core program in business administration, management or public administration; 36 months of training or experience in supervisory, administrative, managerial, or staff position involving planning, research, or policy/procedure development.
